newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar ends just firmer, thin.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar ends just firmer, thin.

text.p: London's spot August white sugar contract held recent gains on Tuesday and managed to end just firmer in a thin market supported by talk of Russian buying.
"The Russian offtake is the reason why the market is higher, supposedly...but people are a little dubious about selling and also about going short of August," said one trader.
"I think being long of August/October is what most trade people would like to be."
August last traded 60 cents higher at $319.00 and October was up 40 cents at $308.60. Volume totalled a scant 743 lots, most of which was in August.
Since bursting higher by around $3 at the start of last week, August has been content to trade between $316 and resistance around $319.
Analysts said $323.00 could be another upside objective in the short term.
